prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Observing mode and correlator setup: FDM with 976.563 kHz frequency resolution and spectral averaged to ~4-5 km/s to lower the data rates. We have added 3 spectral windows to allow for continuum observations.
Sensitivity: We have estimated the expected total molecular gas mass in our targets . On average we have 16 resolution elements per galaxy. We therefore assumed that the molecular gas is evenly distributed across the galaxies. Using a velocity resolution of 30 km/s, which is sufficient to derive the gas kinematics, the lowest noise rms for a 4sigma detection is 0.07 mJy/channel. Since the gas mass estimates are uncertain we have used this estimate for our entire sample.
Angular resolution: We have selected 0.2" for the Band 6 observations. We need the several resolution elements across the target galaxies. The angular size of our galaxies is typically 2" or less.
Dynamic range: We aim at detecting the CO line across the target galaxies, but are not aiming at a high dynamic range.

Observing mode and correlator setup: FDM with 976.563 kHz frequency resolution and spectral averaged to ~4-5 km/s to lower the data rates. We have added 3 spectral windows to allow for continuum observations. In this Science Goal we have included 6 targets. The CO(4-3) line can be observed for all of these sources with a single setup of the correlator and spectral windows.
Sensitivity: We have estimated the expected total molecular gas mass in our targets . On average we have 16 resolution elements per galaxy. We therefore assumed that the molecular gas is evenly distributed across the galaxies. Using a velocity resolution of 30 km/s, which is sufficient to derive the gas kinematics, the lowest noise rms for a 4sigma detection is 0.07 mJy/channel. Since the gas mass estimates are uncertain we have used this estimate for our entire sample.
Angular resolution: We have selected 0.2" for the Band 6 observations. We need the several resolution elements across the target galaxies. The angular size of our galaxies is typically 2" or less.
Dynamic range: We aim at detecting the CO line across the target galaxies, but are not aiming at a high dynamic range.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose a program with ALMA Band 6 to observe the CO 4-3 transition of 20 clumpy star-forming galaxies at 0.7<z<1.2 to address a critical question of early galaxy formation: the physical origin of giant star-forming clumps. Our proposed dataset -- the molecular gas surface density, velocity dispersion, and rotation -- will provide the first direct and robust measurements of two key parameters to test current clump formation scenarios: the spatially-resolved Toomre Q parameter and the Toomre mass of these galaxies. These measurements can currently only be done with the capability of ALMA. Our sample selection at z~1, bridging both scientific interests and observational practice, ensures a high enough signal-to-noise ratio for a statistically meaningful sample in ~11 hours. This will lay the groundwork for future ALMA observations at higher resolution and at higher redshift.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
